intro: Stenospermation brachypodum, commonly known as the narrow-spermate broadfoot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of Africa and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
